channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#0954; 02:32PM; 645 N Gardner St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3KCizHD; #Fairfax; Thirty LAFD firefighters responded to find a contents-only fire inside of a one-story single family home (site of previous burn). It took crews 12 minutes (2:44pm) to extinguish the flames, keeping it from spreading to the structure itself. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 41; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 5; BC14 E227 E261 E41 E52 E61 RA41 RA861 SO1 T27 T61; CH9; 12; Nicholas Prange

Hiker Rescue; INC#0881; 01:38PM; 20800 Waveview Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3EOFpZd; #PacificPalisades; LAFD responded to an approximately 21-year-old female, following a mountain bike crash on a remote trail near Trippet Ranch in Topanga State Park. Paramedics made contact with the patient via ground, while LAFD Air Ops landed nearby. Ground crews transferred her into the helicopter, which took off and transported her to an area hospital in moderate condition. Nothing further.; FS 23; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; AO1 AO2 BC18 BP23 E23 E237 H1 H7 HA1 HA7 RA23 RH214 T37; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Hiker Rescue; INC#0604; 10:29AM; 17399 Sesnon Blvd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3EOzeEv; #GranadaHills; LAFD responded to an approximately 25-year-old male hiker with a lower leg injury in a remote area near O'Melveny Park. Thank you to LACoFD Air Ops for responding in mutual aid assistance for the hoist and hospital transport of the patient (LAFD was responding to two other hikers and a brush incident at the time). Nothing further.; FS 18; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; BC15 E18 E275 H0A RA87 RH214 T75; CH8; 18; Nicholas Prange

Physical Rescue; INC#0110; 02:19AM; 6800 W Milner Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/48BOMth; #HollywoodHills; Two-vehicle traffic collision with two patients trapped. Firefighters used hydraulic rescue tools to free both patients, but sadly one of them was beyond medical help and had already succumbed to their injuries on scene. Three others were transported: two approximately 30-year-old females in moderate condition, and one approximately 35-year-old female in critical condition (initially trapped). Motorists, expect congestion and delay, avoid the immediate area and consider an alternate route. Detours are readily available. Monitor traffic reports on news radio for updates.; FS 27; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; BC5 E227 E27 E61 E76 EM11 EM14 EM9 HR3 RA27 RA35 RA56 RA61 RA76 RA861 T27 UR88; CH7; 12; Nicholas Prange

Traffic Collision - Fatality; INC#0208; 04:45AM; SB 405 Fwy x Skirball Center Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3jxvv4y; #Brentwood; One vehicle into the back of the trailer of a semi truck. Sadly, the patient was beyond medical help. Due to the fatality, all lanes of the 405 freeway have been closed (unknown duration). Motorists: expect congestion and delay, avoid the immediate area and consider an alternate route. Monitor traffic reports on news radio for updates. CHP Log 264.; FS 109; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 11; BC9 E109 E19 E237 E71 EM9 HR3 RA19 RA71 T37 UR88; CH7; 12; Nicholas Prange

Update Structure Fire; INC#1632; 09:02PM; 436 S Boyle Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3IrVZ3n; #BoyleHeights; Forty-six firefighters arrived at the burning vacant home, and immediately went to work protecting the neighboring buildings. Crews did not enter the building due to it being the site of many previous burns and structural integrity was already compromised. Firefighters managed to protect both neighboring residential structures, and have knocked down the bulk of the flames. This will be an extended operation to slowly and carefully finish eliminating hot spots in the burned out fire unit. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; AR1 BC1 BC11 BC5 CM20 CM22 E17 E2 E201 E202 E203 E209 E210 E221 E25 E3 E4 E9 EA1 EM11 HR3 RA1 RA2 RA25 RA3 RA803 RA809 SO1 SQ21 T1 T10 T2 T21 T3 T9 UR3 UR88; CH7; 13 14; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1632; 08:19PM; 436 S Boyle Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3IrVZ3n; #BoyleHeights; Vacant home with fire showing (site of previous burn) with structures threated on both sides. Firefighters are in the defensive mode, and focusing on protecting the neighboring buildings (both residential).; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 E2 E202 E25 E4 RA2 RA25 SQ21 T2 T9; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

Auto vs Motorcycle - Fatality; INC#1548; 07:20PM; 3191 S Sepulveda Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ZndGbL; #Palms; Firefighters responded to the scene of an auto vs motorcycle traffic collision, with one car involved with fire. Firefighters quickly extinguished the flames, but sadly, one adult male was killed by the initial collision (not fire). One adult female was transported to the hospital with minor injuries (none fire-related). One or more street lanes will remain closed in the area until the LAPD investigation and Medical Examiner operations are complete (unknown duration). Please consider taking alternate routes to avoid the immediate area. LAPD Incident # 4182; FS 59; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 5; E292 E59 E62 RA59 T92; CH4; 12; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1317; 06:36PM; 1623 N Mariposa Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/45YIHoN; East Hollywood; KNOCKDOWN 70 Firefighters extinguished the fire in 34 minutes. They contained the fire primarily to the unit of origin on the 2nd floor with some extension up the wall to the 3rd floor unit but not inside the unit itself. There are two occupants of the unit being assessed for possible smoke inhalation Cause and $ loss TBD. No further details.; FS 35; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC1 BC11 BC5 CM20 CM22 E203 E220 E227 E229 E235 E3 E35 E41 E52 E56 E82 EA1 EM1 EM11 EM14 HR3 RA20 RA52 RA56 RA803 RA835 T20 T27 T29 T3 T35 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#1317; 06:02PM; 1623 N Mariposa Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/45YIHoN; East Hollywood; [Corrected Alert] Three story (Pre-43) center hall apartment building with light smoke showing upon LAFD arrival. Firefighters initiated an offensive attack and located heavy smoke compartmentalized behind a Ponet (fire) door. They created a hose lay behind the door and made entry to find fire in one unit. Two additional task forces requested. ; FS 35; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC1 BC11 BC5 CM20 CM22 E203 E220 E227 E229 E235 E3 E35 E41 E52 E56 E82 EA1 EM1 EM11 EM14 HR3 RA20 RA52 RA56 RA803 RA835 T20 T27 T29 T3 T35 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Margaret Stewart
